alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 3:28AM PST until January 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW EARLY TODAY FOLLOWED BY MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TONIGHT NIGHT INTO THURSDAY... .A weak system will spread light to moderate snow across the Cascade crest and over southeast Washington into the southern to central Idaho Panhandle this morning. This is expected to result in a slippery drive for the Wednesday morning commute. A stronger and wetter storm system arrives tonight with moderate to heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible for much of eastern Washington and the Idaho Panhandle. Major disruptions to travel will be possible, including the Thursday morning commute. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. * WHERE...Grand Coulee, Coulee City, Quincy, Wilbur, Ephrata, Ritzville, Harrington, Othello, Odessa, Moses Lake, and Creston. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin
